meanings.definition: (verb) past tense of winterfeed: to provide food for animals during the winter
meanings.sent1: Last year, we winterfed the cows to ensure they had enough to eat during the cold months.
meanings.sent2: The farmer winterfed the horses with hay and grains to keep them healthy in the winter.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels winterfed on the nuts they had hidden away in the fall.
meanings.sent4: The kind farmer winterfed the birds by hanging feeders in the trees.
meanings.sent5: She winterfed the rabbits by leaving carrots out for them near their burrows.

meanings.sent1: The winterfed animals were well-prepared for the cold season.
meanings.sent2: The winterfed deer had thick coats to keep them warm in the snow.
meanings.sent3: The winterfed sheep looked content and full in their cozy barn.
meanings.sent4: The winterfed birds chirped happily in the frosty air.
meanings.sent5: The winterfed cows grazed peacefully in the snowy field.

meanings.definition: (adverb) in a manner related to feeding animals during the winter
meanings.sent1: The farmer worked diligently and winterfed the animals with care.
meanings.sent2: She observed the animals closely and winterfed them appropriately.
meanings.sent3: The children played outside, pretending to winterfeed imaginary animals.
meanings.sent4: The birds chirped cheerfully as the farmer winterfed them daily.
meanings.sent5: The farmer smiled warmly as he winterfed the animals in the chilly barn.
